scripts.say: Polaris, Saratoga, do your best!
Dewey, your skirt!
Eek! S-sorry, I got a bit too excited there...
Don't worry, it's fine. We've all got to do our best to cheer everyone on, right?
Yeah...! When I see Lexington cheering alongside us, it's as if energy keeps welling up from within me!
Ahh... I want to be able to dance on that stage too...
Come to think of it, I've been wondering ever since our practice sessions began, but why did we get chosen for Polaris?
Hm? What do you mean by that?
Aren't there several proper idols in the fleet? Many of them have ample musical experience, yet they chose a complete amateur like me.
That's a good point... but didn't Akashi say they chose at random?
Gascogne is equipped with modular protocols, allowing change of modes depending on the conditions. Assessment: Gascogne is very suitable for experimental armament trials.

Furthermore, regarding vocals: It is possible to adjust external appearance and vocal range by fine-tuning the keel structure, which is beneficial to testing the relationship between ship structure and music.
...I'm happy for you and I'm going to let you finish, but I don't think the rest of us can do stuff like that.
Anyways, I'm not an expert on these matters like Bismarck, so I'm just speculating.
Let's leave it at that. There's no point staying on this subject.
Though some of us in the Sakura Empire were involved with the development of the Muse System, we had no control over the selection process.
I have a feeling that the Muse System isn't the only thing being tested. We, as Polaris, are as well.
In short, we just have to keep things as they are.
That's right. Let's focus on finishing our test run first, shall we?
(That's right... This will determine whether or not the Muse System can be used on our ships...)
